articles.headline: Sweeping Away Gender-Specific Toys and Labels
articles.snippet: Retailers and manufacturers are heeding concerns about stereotyping that some parents say still pervades children’s toys, clothes, costumes and other items.
articles.abstract: Retailers and manufacturers are heeding concerns about stereotyping that some parents say still pervades children’s toys, clothes, costumes and other items.
articles.lead_paragraph: Aliceana Belling marched past the rows of pink princess dresses at her local Walmart last month and headed straight to the superhero outfits.

articles.headline: Race and Discipline in Spotlight After South Carolina Officer Drags Student
articles.snippet: A deputy working at Spring Valley High School is on leave and under investigation after pulling a black high school student backward in her desk and dragging her.
articles.abstract: A deputy working at Spring Valley High School is on leave and under investigation after pulling a black high school student backward in her desk and dragging her.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLUMBIA, S.C. — Videos of a white sheriff’s deputy throwing a black high school girl to the floor of a classroom thrust this community into an unsettling national discussion Tuesday about whether black students are disproportionately punished.
articles.byline: By Richard Fausset, Richard Pérez-Peña and Alan Blinder

articles.headline: F.D.A. Cites Unapproved Device in Theranos Review, and Faults Handling of Complaints
articles.snippet: An inspection of the blood testing company found that its tiny blood collection tubes had not been cleared by regulators. It was also found to be lax on following up on consumer complaints.
articles.abstract: An inspection of the blood testing company found that its tiny blood collection tubes had not been cleared by regulators. It was also found to be lax on following up on consumer complaints.
articles.lead_paragraph: The pressure on the medical testing company Theranos intensified Tuesday when the Food and Drug Administration released two reports saying the company had used an unapproved medical device, did not adequately follow up on customer complaints and had various deficiencies in quality control procedures.

articles.headline: Walgreens to Buy Rite Aid for $9.4 Billion
articles.snippet: A merger of the drugstore chains would be the latest example of consolidation throughout the health care industry.
articles.abstract: A merger of the drugstore chains would be the latest example of consolidation throughout the health care industry.
articles.lead_paragraph: As companies throughout the universe of the health care industry accelerate the pace of consolidation, two of the country’s biggest drugstore chains have agreed to combine to create a new giant.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced and Hiroko Tabuchi

articles.headline: Deeply Divided Republican Electorate Drifts Toward Ben Carson, Poll Shows
articles.snippet: The survey of Republicans showed Mr. Carson leading Donald J. Trump in the presidential race and the strong divisions within the party.
articles.abstract: The survey of Republicans showed Mr. Carson leading Donald J. Trump in the presidential race and the strong divisions within the party.
articles.lead_paragraph: The latest New York Times-CBS News poll makes Republican Party divisions clear, from the choice of a presidential nominee to whether party members are willing to see their leaders compromise on legislation.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Martin and Megan Thee-Brenan

articles.headline: ISIS Captives Say They Faced Blade as Rescue Came
articles.snippet: In interviews, four of the 69 Arab prisoners of the Islamic State freed in a military raid last week described life under the thumb of the Islamic State.
articles.abstract: In interviews, four of the 69 Arab prisoners of the Islamic State freed in a military raid last week described life under the thumb of the Islamic State.
articles.lead_paragraph: SALAHADDIN, Iraq — Muhammad Hassan Abdullah al-Jibouri had little hope that he would ever make it out of the Islamic State’s jail alive, and he had not even seen the sun in more than a month. Then, early last Thursday morning, he heard the helicopters overhead.

articles.headline: CNBC May Be the Big Winner of the Next Republican Debate
articles.snippet: The cable financial news network is expecting to beat its own viewership records and is commanding top dollar for advertising as it airs Wednesday’s Republican debate.
articles.abstract: The cable financial news network is expecting to beat its own viewership records and is commanding top dollar for advertising as it airs Wednesday’s Republican debate.
articles.lead_paragraph: The nation’s new favorite reality TV show, the Republican presidential debate, returns on Wednesday. But political-minded viewers will be forgiven for having to consult their channel guides to find it.

articles.headline: House Votes Overwhelmingly to Reopen the Ex-Im Bank
articles.snippet: In a rare act of bipartisanship, representatives approved the legislation in a 313-to-118 vote that defied free-market conservatives.
articles.abstract: In a rare act of bipartisanship, representatives approved the legislation in a 313-to-118 vote that defied free-market conservatives.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The House acted with rare bipartisanship on Tuesday to approve legislation that would reopen the federal Export-Import Bank, after a debate that underscored the split between the party’s traditional pro-business members and ascendant free-market conservatives who are suspicious of big corporations.

articles.headline: Volkswagen, Hit by Emissions Scandal, Posts Its First Loss in Years
articles.snippet: The automaker had a net loss of $1.84 billion in its third quarter, an indicator of how the fallout from its diesel deception could hurt its bottom line.
articles.abstract: The automaker had a net loss of $1.84 billion in its third quarter, an indicator of how the fallout from its diesel deception could hurt its bottom line.
articles.lead_paragraph: FRANKFURT — A remarkable period of growth ended at Volkswagen on Wednesday when the carmaker reported its first quarterly loss in at least 15 years and began the costly process of absorbing the expense of fixing millions of cars designed to cheat on emissions tests.

articles.headline: Migrant Children, Arriving Alone and Frightened
articles.snippet: Many of Europe’s new mystery children are boys ages 14 to 17, sent by families too poor to pay smugglers for more than one journey. Others were separated from their parents along the way.
articles.abstract: Many of Europe’s new mystery children are boys ages 14 to 17, sent by families too poor to pay smugglers for more than one journey. Others were separated from their parents along the way.
articles.lead_paragraph: PASSAU, Germany — Reza Mohammadi lost his parents in a forest in Macedonia. Or Serbia. He does not remember. What he does remember is that it was raining: Thick mud clung to his shoes and weighed down his 7-year-old legs.

articles.headline: After a U.S. Shift, Iran Has a Seat at Talks on War in Syria
articles.snippet: Russia has urged the inclusion of representation from Tehran in the Syrian civil war discussions, which will resume in Vienna on Friday.
articles.abstract: Russia has urged the inclusion of representation from Tehran in the Syrian civil war discussions, which will resume in Vienna on Friday.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEHRAN — Iran on Wednesday accepted an invitation to attend a broad new round of negotiations to resolve the Syrian war, sitting with longtime adversaries including the United States and Saudi Arabia who once sought to bar the Iranians from any role in Syria’s future.
articles.byline: By Thomas Erdbrink, Sewell Chan and David E. Sanger
